comments.body: I think at least one of the two `spawn` overloads should have the second argument mandatory. Same applies to the other variant two lines below.
From the docs you linked, it looks like `'ipc'` might also be a valid value.

Yes, but I do not know whether `'ipc'` will make `stdin`, `stdout` and `stderr` a `null` or not. This pull requests only add more overloads in addition to existing ones, which should already allow `'ipc'` (`stdin`, `stdout` and `stderr` in this case will be `Stream | null`).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +151,155 @@
    interface SpawnOptionsWithStdioTuple<
        Stdin extends StdioNull | StdioPipe,
        Stdout extends StdioNull | StdioPipe,
        Stderr extends StdioNull | StdioPipe,

comments.body: I think `number` is also ok here.
@Flarna docs do not seem not eplicitly state that.

I found it there: https://nodejs.org/dist/latest-v12.x/docs/api/child_process.html#child_process_subprocess_kill_signal `signal <number> | <string>` . Seems it's allowed everywhere the user passes something in but in events you always get one of the `NodeJS.Signals` strings.
